content:
Diagnosis:
Squamous cell carcinoma of cervix, FIGO stage IB2
Initial diagnosis March 2024
PD-L1 CPS 70

Previous treatment:
Cycle 1-2 cisplatin-based chemoradiation completed with good tolerance

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg prn
Metoclopramide 10mg prn

Current situation:
Review during week 4 of radiotherapy with concurrent cisplatin

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is progressing well through chemoradiation treatment. She has completed 18 of 25 planned fractions of external beam radiotherapy and received 2 cycles of weekly cisplatin without significant complications. Her main side effects have been grade 1 nausea, well controlled with anti-emetics, and mild fatigue which is not impacting her daily activities. She continues to work part-time and maintains good nutrition and hydration.

On examination today, performance status remains 0. She is clinically well with stable vital signs. Blood results show stable renal function with creatinine 78, normal electrolytes, and adequate haematological parameters for continued treatment.

The plan is to proceed with cycle 3 cisplatin today. She will continue with daily radiotherapy and we will review her again next week before cycle 4. She understands to contact the team if she develops any concerning symptoms in the interim.

cancer_timeline.value: Completed 2 cycles weekly cisplatin with good tolerance
Completed 18 of 25 planned fractions of external beam radiotherapy

patient_facts.value: Mild fatigue not impacting daily activities
Stable renal function with creatinine 78, normal electrolytes, adequate haematological parameters

status_updates.value: Stage IB2 cervical cancer progressing well through concurrent chemoradiation with good tolerance of treatment
Grade 1 nausea controlled with anti-emetics, mild fatigue
Proceeding with cycle 3 cisplatin and continuing daily radiotherapy
Review next week before cycle 4 cisplatin
